adjectives.description: sparable (comparative more sparable, superlative most sparable)

description: From sparrowbill, in reference to its shape, like a sparrow's beak.

entries.meaning: A small headless nail used in making shoes (especially the heels).
examples: [H]e was sometimes seen disputing with the cobbler, his opposite neighbour, about the charge of two-pence; and refusing to pay Crispin's demand, unless he put three or four more sparables in the heels of the shoes which he had mended twice before!
